SENT.plain: Fusiform aneurysms of the basilar artery are extremely unusual
Most show signs of a posterior fossa mass
One case is reported which presented with recurrent transient ischemic attacks suggesting carotid vascular disease
Failure of an appropriate endarterectomy to relieve the symptoms, and later brain stem infarction, led to the correct diagnosis
Whenever recurrent or new symptoms appear following carotid vascular surgery, other diagnoses must be considered
